name: Chandrika — HIV-positive activist
details: ART and welfare benefits — Aadhaar linkage feared to expose HIV-positive status in community (ration shop and other services use same Aadhaar in same neighbourhood)

notes: From V2 primary research. Source: Scroll.in (Menaka Rao) Nov 2017.

name: Sirtaji Devi

location: Mathiadhir village, Naurangia block, Kushinagar, Uttar Pradesh
notes: From V2 primary research. Source: Asia Times / Scroll.in, Mar 2018.

name: Daya Kor

notes: From V2 primary research. Source: Al Jazeera / Pulitzer Center 2023.

case_type: AGGREGATE — PDS ration card cancellations (mass exclusion)
name: 3–4 crore (30–40 million) ration card holders — India-wide
details: PDS rations under NFSA — cards cancelled nationwide because they could not be biometrically linked to Aadhaar
outcome: 30–40 million poor households, mostly below poverty line, lost access to subsidised food. Cards arbitrarily cancelled to show 'savings' from removing 'ghost' beneficiaries.
notes: Gemini cites Supreme Court petition / The Hindu (2021). V2 noted Rajasthan alone had 2.5 million families affected Sept 2016–Jun 2017.

name: 277,115 elderly + 52,479 widows (Haryana) — Daya Kor documented individually (C5)
details: Old-age and widow pensions — Parivar Pehchan Patra (Aadhaar-linked family ID) algorithm wrongly assessed incomes or classified living pensioners as dead
outcome: 329,594 pensions stopped. Haryana State Assembly data. CM Khattar admitted 44,050 (70% of those halted) were wrongly excluded (Aug 2023). Citizens termed it 'Permanent Pareshani Patra'.
notes: Gemini gives more precise breakdown (277,115 + 52,479) than V2's 63,353. Both from Haryana state assembly data / Al Jazeera.
source: Haryana State Assembly data / Al Jazeera (2024)

name: 28% of PMMVY maternity benefit recipients — India-wide
details: Pradhan Mantri Matri Vandana Yojana (maternity benefit) — Aadhaar Payment Bridge System (APBS) overrode beneficiaries' preferred accounts
outcome: 28% of all payments went to accounts different from those provided by beneficiaries (Airtel/FINO payment banks etc.). Mothers during pregnancy/post-birth left without support.
notes: Both V2 and Gemini cite Scroll.in / Niti Aayog data.
source: Scroll.in / Niti Aayog data (Jean Drèze et al.), Jan 2022

name: ~6,000 NREGA workers, Boram block, Jharkhand (incl. Surai Mandi & Sonaram Soren — see E1, E2)
details: NREGA wages — diverted to ICICI/FINO accounts opened behind workers' backs in 2016; accounts then frozen requiring e-KYC to unlock
outcome: 4+ months without wages for entire block. Nationally: Rs 500 crore of NREGA wages rejected in 2017–18, Rs 321 crore still pending. RTI to UIDAI on 'inactive Aadhaar': UIDAI said it did not know what the term meant.
notes: Both V2 and Gemini cite Scroll.in, 2019.

name: ~2.89 crore (28.9 million) active NREGA workers — India-wide

outcome: As of Aug 2023: only 30% of payments made within legally mandated 15 days. Assam: 39% eligible; Nagaland: 45%; Meghalaya: 3.1% eligible.
notes: From V2 primary research. Source: The News Minute, Aug 2023.

name: 40% of NREGA workers nationally (The Hindu survey)

outcome: Wages withheld or delayed; repeated costly trips to authentication centres.
notes: From V2 / @Orionis57 thread. Source: The Hindu, 19 Nov 2020.

name: Multiple HIV-positive patients nationally (Scroll.in investigation)

outcome: Patients dropping out of ART; treatment interruption risks drug resistance and death. Scale not documented by Govt; acknowledged by NACO field workers.
